content.description: The graph below depicts the various components of smog for a densely populated urban area in the Northern Hemisphere. Each plotted line (<math alttext="A" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="C" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="D" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>D</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>) is a different component of smog.
content.question: The data that were used to create this graph were collected in the winter. Which of the following best describes how the graph would be different if the data were collected in the middle of the summer?

choices.label: The peaks for every data line would be at a lower concentration.
Concentrations for component <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> would be higher throughout the graph.
Concentrations for all the data lines would be the horizontal throughout the day.

Components <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>D</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> would peak in the afternoon instead of in the morning.

content.answer: Concentrations for component <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> would be higher throughout the graph.

skill.text: Skill 5.B: Describe relationships among variables in data represented.
